attributes.action: reduce tax on fuel and force garage forecourts to implement reductions with immediate effect when the price of crude oil drops
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Forecourt prices rose this week despite the news that crude oil dropped to 100$ a barrel, down from its highest at 135$. In actual fact, petrol and diesel prices rose by 1p per litre in the last week.  Prices rise in accordance when the price of a barrel rises, so why should the opposite not be true?

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
